result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.17-.199)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.17-.199)] was dismissed by the court.

  • David S Kreger was found guilty of OWI (6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • David S Kreger was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • David S Kreger was found guilty of Resisting an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Pay $3,000 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Treatment for anger management should be considered. Defendant must attend a Victim Impact Panel upon release from prison.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.
Obtain alcohol assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

of Sentencing held 10/22/15
Statement from Defendant

Defendant David S Kreger in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson. Defendant David S Kreger in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties. State moves to dismiss but read in Count 6. Defense has no objection. Court reviews receipt of PSI, recommendation contained therein. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Discussion regarding programming. Defendant's makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.
adding Count 6
to Transport

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: No contact direct or indirect with DL, Rouers Roadhouse Bar.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Not to enter any bars or taverns.
Converted to signature bond.

Defendant David S Kreger in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson.  Defendant David S Kreger in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Counts 1, 4 & 5.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Counts 1, 4 & 5. Court dismisses Counts 2 & 3 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court orders PSI. Court converts cash bond to a signature bond, same conditions apply.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
by Defendant
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Defendant is on ES hold. Status conference set for September 28, 2015 at 10:00. Bond continues as is.
by State
Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant David S Kreger in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson. Defendant David S Kreger in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 7/18/15.

No contact direct or indirect with DL, Rouers Roadhouse Bar. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to enter any bars or taverns. Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant David S Kreger appeared by video conference. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 7/27/15, 10:00.
